items.title: Arizonans Protest State’s Largest Utility Abandoning Clean Energy Commitments
items.description: PHOENIX—Despite a summer in which nearly 600 people are suspected to have died in the increasing heat of the changing climate in the nation’s sunniest state, Arizona’s largest utility walked back its clean energy commitments in August.   Nearly two dozen Arizonans gathered outside Arizona Public Services headquarters Thursday to protest that decision—as well as the […]

items.title: Pennsylvania Plastics Pollution Settlement Could Set a National Precedent for Control of Pellets
items.description: A Pennsylvania plastics manufacturer will pay $2.6 million for allegedly violating the federal Clean Water Act and will ensure that no more of its plastic pellets leak into waterways, under a proposed settlement with two environmental groups. items.title: Coal Is Rising Along with Solar in the U.S. Power System, While Gas Loses a Step
items.description: Coal and utility-scale solar power each gained market share in the first half of this year, newly released data on U.S. electricity generation show. items.title: Fossil-Fueled Climate Heating Set the Stage for Devastating Fires in Spain and Portugal This Summer
items.description: A new attribution report published Thursday shows that global warming made the extreme hot and dry conditions preceding this summer’s wildfires in Portugal and Spain 40 times more likely and 30 percent more intense than in pre-industrial climate conditions. The fires have killed at least eight people, and tens of thousands were evacuated as health-damaging […]
